comment_text: Parkinson's is a neural disorder. It does not have exclusively motor effects. While these are the most noticeable (tremor, shuffling gait, etc.), it has dozens more, including bowel problems, sleep issues, depression, mild cognitive impairment, and others. I generally like SciShow and you usually get things correct, but this is a big miss. I must confess to being disappointed, even though the information is exciting.

Here is my Hurricane Theory: Pangea. More precisely, what would hurricanes be like IF they didn’t have any land to, well, land on? Parkinsons is a truly cruel one. My grandfather, before I can remember, was a good painter, artist, and draftsman. Now he can barely hold a pencil. As the family member who has literally inherited his art supplies/talents, I cannot think of a disease much worse for an artist. It's not hereditary in my family, as far as we know. My grandfather has been exposed to a shocking array of environmental risk factors, from family members who thought microwaving mercury was a good idea to 1960s rocket science to a town where they made the fuel for the atomic bomb. He'd be useless in a study looking for environmental factors. Nevertheless, we've wondered if there was anything genetic priming somebody for parkinsons for years. It hurts, knowing it can't do much to help my grandfather, but at least it might help younger generations.

I would like to remind every one that for the past 15 years the weather channel especially has pushed and pushed that massive hurricanes would be stronger and make landfall more often.  Yet here we are finding out that the exact opposite has happened, despite the spin he tries to put on it.  Just go outside once in a while, fifty years here in Maine and absolutely NOTHING has changed except we haven't had a hurricane threaten us in more than 20 years.  Stop ignoring what you see to believe what you are told.  No one should be littering, no one should be consuming more than is necessary which includes just driving around for the fun of it.  Do your part to take care of your neck of the world and we will be fine.

I watched my Father, once a Great and influential Man, reduced to a MESS of a forgetful, shaking, SICK Shell of what he used to be, over a 15 year period.
I moved him in to take care of him in the last 10 years.... But the last 8 months of his life was beyond what I was capable of. 😭💔
I TRIED to get in-home Care, but couldn't afford it. So after extensive shopping, put him in the absolute best Medical Home I could find.
Even THAT destroyed him. He felt discarded, as he had periods of complete lucidity....
It took a lot out of me as well. He passed in 2012. Since THEN, we seem to be making incredible strides in Parkinson's Research.

To us it seems too late.
But I hope it prevents what our Family went through. I ended up Dirt POOR, living in a slum. I TRIED to help him. I just didn't have the resources.......

It's interesting how many factors impact the development of neurodegenerative diseases. Similar to Parkinson's, most cases of Alzheimer's are caused by environmental factors which lead to the accumulation of plaques. We find plaques in Alzheimer's patients but, intriguingly, also in people who did not show signs of dementia. In these cases, the respective persons have been active throughout their lives and especially trained themselves mentally (I made a video about this). So yeah, staying active is actually crucial to partially prevent neurodegenerative disorders!
